{"step_by_step_thinking": "The infrahyoid muscles are a group of muscles in the neck. According to Document [0], all of the infrahyoid muscles are innervated by the ansa cervicalis from the cervical plexus (C1-C3) except the thyrohyoid muscle, which is innervated by fibers only from the first cervical spinal nerve travelling with the hypoglossal nerve. The ansa cervicalis is a loop of nerves that is part of the cervical plexus. Therefore, the motor supply of the infrahyoid muscles comes from branches of the cervical plexus.", "answer_choice": "A"}
